answers.answer: Monks and nuns could break their vows without sin
The last of the ancient churchyards to retain its original character.
The Parish Church of St Andrew
Chloroplasts trigger the plant's immune system by producing reactive oxygen species through damage to their photosynthetic system.
Damaging photosynthesis systems creates reactive oxygen species.
Systemic acquired resistance is initiated by lower levels of reactive oxygen species, leading to defense-molecule production.
Plants have two major immune responses.
The hypersensitive response involves infected cells sealing off and undergoing programmed cell death.
